Functions to normalize memory management for lists


Functions

list * list_new (void *data, void(*node_free_func)(void *))
 Creates a new list.
void list_free (list *doomed)
 Frees memory allocated by a list and all its list_node children.
void list_node_free (list_node *doomed, void(*node_free_func)(void *))
 Frees memory allocated by the creation of a list_node.

Function Documentation

void list_free ( list *  doomed  ) 

Frees memory allocated by a list and all its list_node children.

Parameters:
[in] doomed A list to be freed
Returns:
void
Frees the memory of the list allocated by list_new(), and all the members of the list (and their corresponding list_node structs,) including the data payloads (using the function passed to list_new() during list creation.)

list* list_new ( void *  data,
void(*)(void *)  node_free_func 
)

Creates a new list.

Parameters:
[in] data The data payload used to initialize the list, or NULL for an empty list.
[in] node_free_func A function to use to free the payload in each list_node. Functions passed must take one argument, the data payload of the node, and have a return type of void.
Returns:
A new list, optionally containing a node with data, or NULL if there was no memory left.
Initializes new linked lists. Use list_free() to free the memory allocated by this function.

void list_node_free ( list_node *  doomed,
void(*)(void *)  node_free_func 
)

Frees memory allocated by the creation of a list_node.

Parameters:
[in] doomed The list node to be freed
[in] node_free_func A function to use to free the data in the node, or NULL to skip.
Returns:
void
Frees the memory used by the passed list_node, and frees the data attached to the list_node using the supplied function, if any.
